alert.note: Alert for Sevier Smoky Mountains (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 2:50PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sevier County through 415 PM EDT... At 349 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, or near Gatlinburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gatlinburg, Smoky Mountains-Clingmans Dome, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Elkmont and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
